description: Identify unsafe websites and notifies users.

blocks.name: checkUrlSafety
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to check if URL are included on any of the Safe Browsing lists. If a URL is found on one or more lists, the matching information is returned.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Google.

args.name: clientId
args.info: A client ID that (hopefully) uniquely identifies the client implementation of the Safe Browsing API.

args.name: clientVersion
args.info: The version of the client implementation.

args.name: threatTypes
args.info: Json array of the threats. See README for more details.

args.name: platformTypes
args.info: Json array of the platforms types. See README for more details.

args.name: threatEntry
args.info: The URL to be checked.

blocks.name: checkUrlsSafety
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to check if URLs are included on any of the Safe Browsing lists. If a URL is found on one or more lists, the matching information is returned.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Google.

args.name: clientId
args.info: A client ID that (hopefully) uniquely identifies the client implementation of the Safe Browsing API.

args.name: clientVersion
args.info: The version of the client implementation.

args.name: threatTypes
args.info: Json array of the threats. See README for more details.

args.name: platformTypes
args.info: Json array of the platforms types. See README for more details.

args.name: threatEntryTypes
args.info: Json array of the threat entries types. See README for more details.

args.name: threatEntries
args.info: Json array of objects. The threats entries. See README for more details.

blocks.name: getThreatLists
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to retrieve the names of the Safe Browsing lists

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Google.

blocks.name: getThreatListUpdates
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to update the Safe Browsing lists in the local database

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Google.

args.name: clientId
args.info: A client ID that (hopefully) uniquely identifies the client implementation of the Safe Browsing API.

args.name: clientVersion
args.info: The version of the client implementation.

args.name: threatType
args.info: The type of the threat.

args.name: platformType
args.info: The type of the platform.

args.name: threatEntryType
args.info: The type of the threat entry.

args.name: state
args.info: The current state of the client for the requested list (the encrypted client state that was received from the last successful list update).

args.name: maxUpdateEntries
args.info: The maximum size in number of entries. The update will not contain more entries than this value. This should be a power of 2 between 2**10 and 2**20. If zero, no update size limit is set.

args.name: maxDatabaseEntries
args.info: Sets the maximum number of entries that the client is willing to have in the local database. This should be a power of 2 between 2**10 and 2**20. If zero, no database size limit is set.

args.name: region
args.info: Requests the list for a specific geographic location. If not set the server may pick that value based on the user's IP address. Expects ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

args.name: supportedCompressions
args.info: Json array. The compression types supported by the client. See README for more details

blocks.name: checkSafetyByHashs
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to check if a URL is on a Safe Browsing list, the client must first compute the hash and hash prefix of the URL

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Google.

args.name: clientId
args.info: A client ID that (hopefully) uniquely identifies the client implementation of the Safe Browsing API.

args.name: clientVersion
args.info: The version of the client implementation.

args.name: clientStates
args.info: Json array. The current client states for each of the client's local threat lists. See README for more details.

args.name: threatTypes
args.info: Json array. The threat types to be checked. See README for more details.

args.name: platformTypes
args.info: Json array. The platform types to be checked. See README for more details.

args.name: threatEntryTypes
args.info: Json array. The entry types to be checked. See README for more details.

args.name: threatEntries
args.info: Json array of objects. The threat entries to be checked. See README for more details.
